newsitem.title: DENMARK: FORECAST - Analysts see lower 2.3 pct Danish 96 GDP.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST - Analysts see lower 2.3 pct Danish 96 GDP.

text.p: Eight analysts polled by Reuters in a survey issued on Tuesday forecast that Denmark's gross domestic product growth would fall to an average 2.3 percent for whole year 1996 from 1995's 2.6 percent.
The estimates ranged between a low 2.1 percent and a high 2.5 percent.

The panel also foresaw fourth quarter 1996 GDP growth an average annual 3.1 percent up on the same 1995 period, compared to a 2.7 percent year-on-year increase in 1996's third quarter with forecasts between 2.5 and 3.8 percent.

The GDP percentage change from the previous quarter was put at an average +0.5 percent compared to +1.0 percent in 1996's previous third quarter, with estimates from 0.0 to +1.0 percent. --Stig Pedersen, Copenhagen newsroom +45-33969651
